cx.corp.lacuna.core.linux

Class LinuxRawMemoryWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cx.corp.lacuna.core.linux.LinuxRawMemoryWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RawMemoryWriter

    public class LinuxRawMemoryWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements RawMemoryWriter

    The LinuxRawMemoryWriter class reads a process's memory using a ReadableMemoryProvider.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinuxRawMemoryWriter(WritableMemoryProvider memoryProvider)
      Constructs a new LinuxRawMemoryWriter with the specified readable memory provider.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void write(NativeProcess process, int offset, byte[] buffer)
      Writes the specified bytes to the offset of the process's memory.

        public LinuxRawMemoryWriter(WritableMemoryProvider memoryProvider)

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(NativeProcess process,
                  int offset,
                  byte[] buffer)
           throws MemoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: RawMemoryWriter
        Writes the specified bytes to the offset of the process's memory.
        Specified by:
        write in interface RawMemoryWriter
        Parameters:
        process - the native process whose memory the data is written to.
        offset - the memory address offset at which the data is written to. This value is interpreted as an unsigned integer, meaning that negative values are allowed.
        buffer - the data to write.
        Throws:
        MemoryAccessException - if writing fails due to, for eaxmple, an access violation or insufficient rights.
